description.narrative: Open Connect Limited (OCL or the Company) is the leading provider of carrier services to telecom operators in Malawi. Having recently been unbundled from Malawi Telecommunications Limited (MTL) and privatized through a competitive tender process, OCL now requires debt funding to complement equity investments from its new investors, for its capital expenditure program for the next two years. Specifically, IFCs funding will be used to (i) deploy fiber for providing fiber to the Business, Home and Tower (FTTx) services within Malawi, (ii) build a Tier III data centre, (iii) acquire international internet capacity for domestic distribution, and (iv) fund working capital (the Project). IFCs investment promotes infrastructure sharing under wholesale open-access principles and enables OCL to remain active and competitive in the Malawian telecom market.

The Project is expected to increase access to digital connectivity for end-users in Malawi by deploying fiber for increased access and improved service quality and indirectly by increasing the capacity of the broadband network. This will be further enhanced by the construction of the first Tier III data center in Malawi, which will result in increased availability of data storage capacity in the country, with the potential to enhance productivity growth for businesses and increase access to digital services for individuals. Beyond the Project, the investment will contribute to creating a competitive market for digital connectivity in the country and create a market for cloud computing.
